Are Scott Derrickson and Ed Wood of the same nationality?Who was Charles Rennie Mackintosh, and what were his contributions to art and architecture during the Art Nouveau and Art Deco periods?

Charles Rennie Mackintosh was a Scottish artist, architect, designer, and illustrator. He was a prominent figure in the Arts and Crafts Movement and played a significant role in developing the style known as Art Nouveau in Scotland. His contributions spanned various art forms, including graphic design, painting, architecture, and industrial design.

Mackintosh's architectural designs are characterized by their elegant Art Nouveau style. He designed furniture, wallpapers, textiles, and porcelain as well. His architectural works include some of Scotland’s most iconic buildings, such as the Glasgow School of Art, originally known as Glasgow High School of Decorative and Industrial Art.

Mackintosh's graphic design and illustrations were highly influential and showcased his distinctive style, combining traditional Victorian motifs with modern Art Nouveau elements. His designs for posters, invitations, and book covers were among the early examples of graphic art.
